explanations.A: This is the number BEFORE 590, but we want the number after. We need to count forwards instead of backwards.
explanations.B: Not quite - we want to count on 10, not just 1!
explanations.C: You have added 1 to the 9 in the tens column to get 10, which is a good start, but remember ten tens make one hundred! We can carry that one into the hundreds column.
explanations.D: Counting on ten from 590 gets us to 600 (as 90 + 10 = 100).

explanations.A: Counting on ten from 330 gets us to 340 (as 30 + 10 = 40).
explanations.B: This is the number BEFORE 330, but we want the number after. We need to count forwards instead of backwards.
explanations.C: Not quite - we want to count on 10, not 100!
explanations.D: Not quite - we want to count on 10, not just 1!

explanations.A: Skip counting in 10s from 780 we would count 790, 800 so we do say 800... Which number can we not get to by adding on 10s?
explanations.B: If we are skip counting in 10s, the next number will be 780 + 10 = 790. Which number here can we not get to by adding 10s on to 780?
explanations.C: If we keep skip counting in 10s for long enough, we reach 990! Which number can we not get to by counting in 10s from 780?
explanations.D: If we are skip counting in 10s, the next number will be 780+ 10 = 790, so we will not say 789.

explanations.A: If we keep skip counting in 10s for long enough, we reach 500! Which number can we not get to by counting in 10s from 420?
explanations.B: If we keep skip counting in 10s for long enough, we reach 620! Which number can we not get to by counting in 10s from 420?
explanations.C: If we are skip counting in 10s, the next number will be 420 + 10 = 430, then 430 + 10 = 440, so we will not say 432.
explanations.D: Skip counting in 10s from 420 we would count 420, 430, 440, 450, 460, 470, 480 so we do say 480... Which number can we not get to by adding on 10s?

explanations.A: This is the number BEFORE 831, but we want the number after. We need to count forwards instead of backwards.
explanations.B: Almost! But I think you started counting on 831. We want to count up 832, 833, ...
explanations.C: Not quite, 931 is 100 after 831, not 10 after. Which digit in the number is the tens digit?
explanations.D: Counting on ten from 831 gets us to 841 .

explanations.A: Look at the pattern carefully - we want to count back 10, not 100. Which number is 10 before 609?
explanations.B: Counting back 10 from 609 we get 608, 607, 606, 605, 604, 603, 602, 601, 600, 599, so 599 is the previous number in the pattern.
explanations.C: Almost, but think about what happens in the hundreds column. We are counting backwards, so we should get to a number that is smaller than 609.
explanations.D: 639 is the next number after 629. We want the number at the beginning of the sequence, before 609!
